name: Yolton, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Railroad Company

judges: Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearne, Jones, Bell, Ladner and Chidsey, JJ.
parties: Yolton, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Railroad Company.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The judgment of the court below is affirmed upon that part of the opinion of Judge Carson set forth in the reporter’s notes.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: George I. Bloom, with him Michael Hanna, J. Salem Flack and Bloom, Bloom & Yard, for appellant.
Stephen D. Marriner, with him Rufus S. Marriner and Marriner, Wiley & Marriner, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Yolton, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Railroad Company.
Argued October 3, 1951.
Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearne, Jones, Bell, Ladner and Chidsey, JJ.
November 13, 1951:
George I. Bloom, with him Michael Hanna, J. Salem Flack and Bloom, Bloom & Yard, for appellant.
Stephen D. Marriner, with him Rufus S. Marriner and Marriner, Wiley & Marriner, for appellee.
